sentence.Network_cn: 校长谴责对老师不敬的学生.

sentence.Network_en: I am appalled that one so - called authority could castigate thousands of successful, worthwhile programs.
sentence.Network_cn: 我感到震惊的是一个 所谓 的权威竟然能够苛刻地批评成千上万成功而有价值的节目.

sentence.Network_en: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism.
sentence.Network_cn: 马克思抓住每一个机会严厉谴责殖民主义。

list.abs: 鞭的解释 | 鞭... ... [ flog lash castigate thrash ] 用鞭子抽打 [ thrash flog lash whip ] 用鞭子抽打.
lady , don't photocopy any more.Otherwise , you may get castigations .小姐，不要在影印了，你会得到报应的!

when they castigate an English-language newspaper in Shanghai for publishing " rumors " about mines the Yangtze River , they are asserting the rights of power against the individual right .当他们申斥上海一家英文报纸发表长江内有水雷的“谣言”时，他们是在使用政权的力量反对个人权利。
the remark was a Labour Party spokesman to castigate the Government for this attempt , which , in Labour's opinion is bound to lead to disaster .这个评语是工党发言人用来严厉批评政府的这个企图，这一企图在工党看来是肯定要引向灾难的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin castigare 'reprove', from castus 'pure, chaste'

entry.def: If you castigate someone or something, you speak to them angrily or criticize them severely.

example.ex: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism...
example.tran: 马克思抓住每一个机会严厉谴责殖民主义。

example.ex: She castigated him for having no intellectual interests.
example.tran: 她斥责他没有智识兴趣。

sentences.sentence: "She chastised him for his insensitive remarks"

auth_sentence.content: Dickens was careful to castigate abuses which were being reformed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dickens was careful to castigate abuses which were being reformed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dickens was careful to castigate abuses which were being reformed.

auth_sentence.content: But don't castigate the scientific method.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But don't castigate the scientific method.

auth_sentence.content: The reflexive liberal response was to castigate the likes of Mrs. Braly.
auth_sentence.res_content: The reflexive liberal response was to castigate the likes of Mrs. Braly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The reflexive liberal response was to castigate the likes of Mrs. Braly.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cast纯洁+e→来自贵族自认是纯种,引申为社会的等级
cast纯洁+ig+ate表动词→使……纯洁→惩罚[错误]

means.word_mean: 严厉责骂、批评或惩罚(某人)

sentences.en: The principal castigate the student who have insult their teacher.
sentences.cn: 校长谴责对老师不敬的学生。

sentences.en: I am appalled that one so - called authority could castigate thousands of successful , worthwhile programs.
sentences.cn: 我感到震惊的是一个所谓的权威竟然能够苛刻地批评成千上万成功而有价值的节目。

sentences.en: The film mercilessly castigates the old society.
sentences.cn: 影片对旧社会进行了无情的鞭挞。

sentences.en: He castigated the secretaries for their sloppy job of filing.
sentences.cn: 由于秘书们档案工作搞得马虎草率，他严厉地斥责了他们。
